|Title=Knowing the principles of antibiotic therapy in patients with non-community infections
|Description=Know how to identify the risk of resistant infectious agents and adapt antibiotic therapy in non-community patients.
|Rubric=Management
|Contributors=
|Order=17}}
'''The elements to be taken into account when assessing the risk of a resistant infectious agent in a patient with a healthcare-associated infection are''' :

* Length of hospital stay
* Selection pressure from prior antibiotic therapy (duration, spectrum)
* Presence of implanted equipment
* Recent history of surgery or endoscopy
* History of colonisation or infection with a multi-resistant infectious agent
* Chronic haemodialysis or living in an institution (increased risk of infection with methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus).


'''In the event of sepsis/septic shock in the context of a healthcare-associated infection without an identified focus, the following antibiotic therapy may be proposed'' :

* A broad-spectrum ß-lactam active against nosocomial Gram-negative bacilli (to be chosen according to the ecology of the ward and the patient's microbiological history): piperacillin/tazobactam '''OR''' cefepime '''OR'' carbapenem (meropenem or imipenem).
* Amikacin
* vancomycin (if meticillin-resistant staphylococcus needs to be covered)
+/- echinocandin (depending on the patient's condition and severity)

question.title: Assessing the risk of resistant infectious agents in patients with healthcare-associated infections
question.description: Which of the following factors should be considered when assessing the risk of a resistant infectious agent in a patient with a healthcare-associated infection?

option_a.title: Recent history of surgery or endoscopy
option_a.description: A recent history of surgery or endoscopy is a risk factor for resistant infectious agents

option_b.title: Chronic haemodialysis or living in an institution
option_b.description: Chronic haemodialysis or living in an institution is a risk factor for resistant infectious agents

option_c.title: Length of hospital stay
option_c.description: Length of hospital stay is a risk factor for resistant infectious agents

option_d.title: History of colonisation or infection with a multi-resistant infectious agent
option_d.description: A history of colonisation or infection with a multi-resistant infectious agent is a risk factor for resistant infectious agents
